section.hand:
To my L. Treasuror
e 15 June 90

page.section:
Belgia 1590 15 June To my L. Trea
s
page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
L. there are two honest gentlemen in
London
bothe of my acquaintance
M
r
William Gent
and
M
r
John Chamberlain
w
th
whome I have som bussines, that doth concerne ther estate, and
myne owne veary neere. And because it is a matter of bargayne
and cannot well be concluded but by mutuall communication, they are
both desirous to make a voiage unto me. In w
ch
respect, least their
passing beyonde the Seas, should turne to their prejudice, I am to
pray yo
r
L. to give them the charge of carrieng hether the next
packet, either from her
Ma
tie
or from my
LL of the Councel
. Yow
shall bestowe in so doing a singular favor upon us, and fo
r
the good
meaning
demeanor
of the gentlemen, because I knowe them very inwardly, I
will pawne my Credit in their behalf, as farre as yo
r
L. shalbe
pleased to accept it.
And so I take my humble leave //
from the
Haegh
Juny A
o
90
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
